page.title: 17LOWER FORGE
page.content: { Lower Forge}is a small hamlet of about{10 stone cottages.}It lies on the western bank of the{River Severn, at the end of a steep mud track. As the name implies the hamlet was once the site of old iron workings. The remains of the forge can now be seen together with the 10 metre high chimney. The forge is now{overgrown with follage, which makes it hard to see from the river. Life at the hamlet is{very quiet, where the population do their own thing. Most people have lived at the forge for about 40 years and are now getting on in age. The houses are{not generaly{in good condition}as it is felt apperances do not matter, like in a housing estate. For the{young life in the forge is considered as {"boring".
